dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3635 IH: Foreign Adversary Investment Prohibition Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kean (for himself and Ms. Scholten) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To prohibit Members of Congress from conducting certain financial transactions involving a foreign adversary of the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Adversary Investment Prohibition Act.

section.header: Prohibition with respect to certain transactions by Members of Congress with a foreign adversary

subsection.text: A Member of Congress may not, during the term of service of the Member of Congress, conduct any covered financial transaction that benefits, directly or indirectly, a foreign adversary or an entity owned or operated by a foreign adversary.

paragraph.text: The Attorney General may bring a civil action in an appropriate district court of the United States against any person who violates, or whom the Attorney General has reason to believe is engaging in conduct that violates, subsection (a).
If the court finds by a preponderance of the evidence that a person violated subsection (a), the court shall impose a civil penalty of not more than—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a first violation of subsection (a), $5,000;
in the case of a second violation of subsection (a), $10,000; and
in the case of each violation of subsection (a) after a second violation under subparagraph (B), $15,000.
The term covered financial transaction includes—

clause.text: any gift, subscription, loan, advance, or deposit of money or anything of value;

subclause.text: a security (as defined in section 3(a) of Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a)));
a security future (as defined in that section); or
a commodity (as defined in section 1a of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 1a)); and

clause.text: any economic interest comparable to an interest described in clause (i) that is acquired through synthetic means, such as the use of a derivative, including an option, warrant, or other similar means.

subparagraph.text: the People’s Republic of China, including the Hong Kong Special Administrative Regions;
the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea;
the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela under the regime of Nicolás Maduro Moros.

paragraph.text: The term Member of Congress means a Senator or Representative in, or Delegate or Resident Commissioner to, the Congress.
